about.title: About ACCP
about.description: During the past 28 years, Asian Conference on Clinical Pharmacy (ACCP) has been a major event in the clinical pharmacy scope in Asia and has been conducted in various countries especially in Asia. Clinical pharmacists have attended this prestigious meeting to share their experience in the fields of practice, research and education in clinical pharmacy.

callForAbstracts.invitation: We cordially invite you to submit scientific abstracts for oral or poster presentations on the following topics:
callForAbstracts.formatDoc: All abstracts must be prepared in Microsoft Word or other file-compatible software and submitted in .doc or .docx
callForAbstracts.englishOnly: The abstract should be written in English and should not contain any references or footnotes. None of the abbreviations are allowed in the abstract, either in the title or abstract.
callForAbstracts.wordCount: The word count for the abstract should be 250 - 300 words.
callForAbstracts.structureTitle: The abstract is structured as follows:
callForAbstracts.titleFormat: (in bold sentence case and Arial 11 font)
callForAbstracts.titleRule1: Abbreviations must not be used in the title.
callForAbstracts.titleRule2: The first letter of the first word in the title sentence must be a CAPITAL letter.
callForAbstracts.authorRule1: The name of each author must include the First Name followed by the Surname or Last Name. No titles (MS, PhD, PharmD, etc.) are added.
callForAbstracts.authorRule2: Use superscripted numbers if you need to include multiple affiliations.
callForAbstracts.authorRule3: If the abstract is from a single institution, please remove superscripted numbers.
callForAbstracts.authorRule4: The contact address and email address of the corresponding author must also be provided.
callForAbstracts.abstractFormat: The organization of the abstract body should be covered:
callForAbstracts.keywordsFormat: Keywords of research (maximum five words), in alphabetical order below the abstract (Arial 11 font, single line spacing).
callForAbstracts.importantNote: Important: The results should be completed, works in progress are not acceptable.
callForAbstracts.step1: Prior to abstract submission, the author must first register using the online registration system. Please ensure to select "Oral or Poster Presenter" during the registration process. After registration, you may log in to your account via the "Login" page using your username and password.
callForAbstracts.step2: To submit your abstract(s), please navigate to "My Account" and click "Add Paper Title" to input your title of abstract(s).
callForAbstracts.step3: Following that, you can upload your abstract(s) via "Upload Abstract/Paper" (only in .doc or .docx format) and change the title if necessary. Of note, each presenter is allowed to submit a maximum of 2 abstracts.
callForAbstracts.submissionNote: Note: The entire submission process should be completed online (not by email) to guarantee a smooth administration.
callForAbstracts.fullPaperNote: Full Paper: Detailed information regarding the full paper submission is provided later.
callForAbstracts.ctaDesc: Check our detailed submission guidelines for format and requirements.
callForAbstracts.lateBreakingDesc: Have recent groundbreaking research? Submit your late-breaking abstract for consideration. Limited slots available.

policies.overviewDesc: Please review the following policies carefully before registering for ACCP 2026. All cancellation requests must be submitted in writing to
policies.refundScheduleDesc: Refund amounts are based on the date the cancellation request is received
policies.refund80Desc: Cancellation received before May 1, 2026 (60+ days before event)
policies.refund50Desc: Cancellation received May 1 - June 8, 2026 (30-60 days before event)
policies.refund0Desc: Cancellation received after June 8, 2026 (less than 30 days)
policies.importantFee: Important: All refunds are subject to a 20% administrative fee. No-shows without prior cancellation notice are not eligible for any refund.
policies.cancellationRule1: All cancellation requests must be submitted in writing via email to secretariat@accp2026.org
policies.cancellationRule2: Cancellation requests must include your full name and registration confirmation number
policies.cancellationRule3: The date of receipt of the written cancellation will determine the refund amount
policies.cancellationRule4: Verbal cancellation requests are not accepted
policies.transferRule1: Registration may be transferred to another person at no additional cost until June 15, 2026
policies.transferRule2: Transfer requests must be submitted in writing with details of both original and new registrant
policies.transferRule3: The new registrant must complete all required registration information
policies.transferRule4: No transfers are permitted after June 15, 2026
policies.eventRule1: In the unlikely event that ACCP 2026 is cancelled, all registrants will receive a full refund
policies.eventRule2: The organizers are not responsible for any other costs incurred (travel, accommodation, etc.)
policies.eventRule3: If the event is postponed, registrations will be automatically transferred to the new dates
policies.forceMajeureDesc: The organizers shall not be liable for any failure to perform obligations under these terms if such failure results from circumstances beyond our reasonable control, including but not limited to: natural disasters, acts of government, pandemics, civil unrest, or other unforeseen circumstances.
policies.faq1Q: How do I cancel my registration?
policies.faq1A: To cancel your registration, please email secretariat@accp2026.org with your registration confirmation number and full name. Cancellation requests must be submitted in writing.
policies.faq2Q: When will I receive my refund?
policies.faq2A: Refunds will be processed within 30 business days after receiving your cancellation request. The refund will be credited to the original payment method used during registration.
policies.faq3Q: Can I transfer my registration to another person?
policies.faq3A: Yes, registration transfers are permitted until June 15, 2026. Please contact secretariat@accp2026.org with details of both the original registrant and the new registrant.
policies.faq4Q: What if I paid for workshops or gala dinner add-ons?
policies.faq4A: Add-on purchases (workshops, gala dinner tickets) follow the same refund policy as the main registration. Partial cancellations are allowed.
policies.faq5Q: What happens if the conference is cancelled?
policies.faq5A: In the unlikely event that ACCP 2026 is cancelled by the organizers, registered participants will receive a full refund of their registration fees.
policies.faq6Q: Can I get a refund if I cannot attend due to visa issues?
policies.faq6A: If your visa application is rejected, please provide official documentation from the embassy. A full refund (minus administrative fees) will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
policies.ctaDesc: Contact our registration team for assistance

travelVisa.importantUpdateTitle: Important Update on Thailand Entry Procedures
travelVisa.importantUpdateDesc: Thailand has fully reopened for international travelers. Most visitors can enter Thailand visa-free or obtain a visa on arrival. Please check the latest entry requirements based on your nationality.
travelVisa.generalInfoDesc: Bangkok, the capital of Thailand, is a vibrant metropolis known for its ornate temples, bustling street life, and world-renowned cuisine. As one of Asia's most cosmopolitan cities, Bangkok offers a perfect blend of traditional culture and modern amenities.
travelVisa.highlight1Desc: Bangkok is a leading medical tourism destination
travelVisa.highlight2Desc: Experience Thai hospitality and ancient traditions
travelVisa.highlight3Desc: Easy transportation with BTS, MRT, and more
travelVisa.highlight4Desc: From street food to Michelin-starred restaurants
travelVisa.weatherDesc: Bangkok has a tropical climate. July temperatures average 28-33°C with occasional rain showers. We recommend bringing an umbrella and light layers for air-conditioned venues.
travelVisa.whatToWearDesc: Light, breathable clothing is recommended. Business casual attire is appropriate for conference sessions. Please note that modest dress is required when visiting temples.
travelVisa.timeDesc: Thailand Standard Time (ICT) is UTC+7. There is no daylight saving time in Thailand.
travelVisa.moneyDesc: The Thai Baht (THB) is the local currency. Credit cards are widely accepted. ATMs are available throughout the city. Approximate exchange rate: 1 USD ≈ 35 THB.
travelVisa.languageDesc: Thai is the official language. English is widely spoken in tourist areas, hotels, and the conference venue.
travelVisa.connectivityDesc: Free WiFi is available at the conference venue, hotels, and many public areas. Local SIM cards with data plans are available at the airport.
travelVisa.suvarnabhumiDesc: The main international gateway, located 30 km east of downtown Bangkok. Connected by Airport Rail Link, taxis, and buses.
travelVisa.donMueangDesc: Serves low-cost carriers and domestic flights. Located 24 km north of the city center. Connected by shuttle bus, taxis, and trains.
travelVisa.visaExemptionDesc: Citizens of many countries can enter Thailand visa-free for tourism purposes (15-90 days depending on nationality). Please verify your specific requirements.
travelVisa.visaOnArrivalDesc: Available for citizens of 19 countries for stays up to 15 days. Fee: 2,000 THB. Requirements include passport validity of 6+ months and proof of accommodation.
travelVisa.btsDesc: Elevated rail system covering major areas of Bangkok. The nearest station to the venue is Chit Lom station (direct connection to CentralWorld).
travelVisa.mrtDesc: Underground metro system. Interchange with BTS is available at several stations.
travelVisa.arlDesc: Connects Suvarnabhumi Airport to downtown Bangkok. Travel time approximately 30 minutes to Phaya Thai station.
travelVisa.taxiDesc: Metered taxis are affordable and widely available. Always request that the driver use the meter. Airport taxis have a fixed surcharge.
travelVisa.banksDesc: Banks are open Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM - 3:30 PM. Currency exchange booths in shopping areas have extended hours.
travelVisa.businessHoursDesc: Most shops open 10:00 AM - 10:00 PM. Convenience stores are open 24 hours.
travelVisa.tippingDesc: Tipping is not mandatory but appreciated. 10-15% for excellent service at restaurants. Small tips for taxi drivers and hotel staff are common.
travelVisa.electricityDesc: 220V, 50Hz. Plugs are typically Type A, B, or C. Universal adapters are recommended.
travelVisa.drinkingWaterDesc: Tap water is not recommended for drinking. Bottled water is inexpensive and widely available.
travelVisa.healthDesc: No specific vaccinations are required. Pharmacies are widely available. Bring sufficient prescription medications with documentation.

accommodation.subtitle: Accommodation
accommodation.introDesc: We have negotiated special rates with selected hotels near the conference venue for ACCP 2026 participants. Book early to secure the best rates and availability.
accommodation.bookingDesc: To receive the special conference rate, please use the booking code "ACCP2026" when making your reservation directly with the hotel or through the provided booking links.
accommodation.importantDesc: Special rates are available until June 1, 2026 or until the room block is full. Early booking is strongly recommended as Bangkok hotels fill up quickly during this period.
